name: froggit
description: Simplify your Git workflow with visual feedback, keyboard-driven controls, and a streamlined experience.
readme_summary: Froggit is a modern, minimalist Git Text User Interface (TUI) designed to enhance the command-line Git experience. It offers visual feedback, keyboard-driven controls, and streamlined Git operations for clarity and speed within the terminal.
key_features: Support for Windows, Linux, and macOS
primary_use_case: To provide developers with a more intuitive and visually organized way to interact with Git directly from their terminal, simplifying common and advanced Git operations.
cover_image_prompt: A friendly, stylized frog wearing a tiny Git t-shirt, sitting comfortably on a large, glowing keyboard. The frog is pointing a small, digital wand towards a swirling vortex of code and branches, which is neatly organizing itself into clean commit messages and branch diagrams. Subtle UI elements resembling a clean terminal interface float around the scene, displaying status updates. The background is a soft, gradient blend of green and blue, evoking a calm and efficient workspace. The overall style is a 3D isometric illustration, emphasizing clarity and approachability, with the repository name 'Froggit' subtly integrated into a small signpost nearby.

name: llm-god
description: Desktop app to multi-prompt ChatGPT, Gemini and more at the same time!
readme_summary: LLM-God is a desktop application for Windows that allows users to simultaneously prompt multiple large language models (LLMs) like ChatGPT, Gemini, and Claude from a single interface. It aims to streamline workflows by eliminating the need to copy-paste between different LLM web interfaces, saving time for both coding and non-coding tasks.
key_features: Supports ChatGPT, Google Gemini, Anthropic Claude, X.ai Grok, DeepSeek, and Copilot
Paste text or screenshots directly into the prompt area
Windows desktop application (Linux version in testing, Mac version available for testing)
Open-source with build and contribution instructions
primary_use_case: To provide a unified desktop interface for interacting with multiple LLM services concurrently, enhancing user productivity by reducing context switching and copy-pasting.
cover_image_prompt: A conductor standing at a grand orchestra podium, holding a single baton that glows with digital energy. Instead of an orchestra, multiple distinct AI 'instruments' (represented by stylized icons of ChatGPT, Gemini, Claude, etc.) are arranged before the conductor. The conductor gestures with the baton, sending a unified stream of musical notes (representing prompts) towards all the AI instruments simultaneously. Each AI instrument then responds by emitting its own unique, glowing waveform (representing generated text). The scene is a modern, minimalist concert hall with subtle digital particle effects and the 'LLM-God' name subtly integrated into the conductor's podium. The style is a 3D isometric illustration with vibrant, contrasting colors for each AI's output.

name: budget_tracker_tui
description: A simple TUI budget tracker app built in rust. Designed to track income and expenses and help visualize and gather basic insights from your transactions.
readme_summary: Budget Tracker TUI is a Rust-based Terminal User Interface application for managing personal finances. It allows users to track income and expenses, categorize transactions, visualize spending with charts, and monitor budget progress directly within the terminal.
primary_use_case: Tracking and visualizing personal income and expenses within a terminal environment.
cover_image_prompt: A wise old owl perched on a branch, meticulously sorting and organizing a stream of glowing coins and bills that flow from a digital waterfall. The owl uses its talons to place items into distinct, labeled pouches representing categories like 'Income', 'Expenses', and 'Savings'. In the background, a subtle, stylized terminal screen displays a simplified, colorful bar chart showing the flow of finances. The scene is set in a cozy, dimly lit library, with small, glowing data particles floating in the air. The repository name 'Budget Tracker TUI' is subtly etched onto the owl's perch. The image should be in a 3D isometric illustration style with a warm, inviting color scheme and clear, soft lighting.

name: Blitzkrieg-2
description: Blitzkrieg 2 is a 2005 real-time tactics video game based on the events of World War II and is the second title in the Blitzkrieg series. The game was developed on an in-house game engine by the company Nival, primarily written in C and C++.
readme_summary: Blitzkrieg 2 is a 2005 real-time tactics video game whose source code was released in 2025 under a non-commercial license. The repository contains the game's engine source code, assets, and development tools, allowing for community, educational, and research use.
key_features: Open-source game engine source code (non-commercial license)
primary_use_case: Providing access to the source code and assets of the Blitzkrieg 2 video game for community, educational, and research purposes under a non-commercial license.
cover_image_prompt: A vintage 2005 computer monitor displaying a World War II battlefield scene from the game Blitzkrieg 2. Emerging from the screen are glowing, ethereal blueprints and code snippets, symbolizing the released source code. A magnifying glass hovers over the blueprints, highlighting specific sections, representing analysis and research. In the background, a subtle 'open source' icon is integrated into a digital landscape. The overall mood is one of historical preservation and open access to game development knowledge. The style should be a blend of retro-futurism and technical illustration, with a focus on clear, readable elements and a muted, strategic color palette.

name: cheatshh
description: Cheatshh is a CLI tool to store commands and their descriptions in a place you can look into as cheatshheat so you dont have to remember them.
readme_summary: Cheatshh is an interactive command-line interface (CLI) tool written in shell script for managing and accessing command-line cheatsheets. It allows users to store, group, and easily retrieve commands with their descriptions, TLDR, and man pages, reducing the need to memorize commands.
key_features: Interactive CLI for managing command-line cheatsheets
Store, group, and view commands with descriptions, TLDR, and man pages
Configuration options for colors, man page display, and integration with other cheatsheet services
Fuzzy finder (fzf) and whiptail powered interface
primary_use_case: To provide users with a quick and organized way to store, access, and recall command-line commands and their associated information, acting as a personal command-line reference.
cover_image_prompt: A wise old librarian in a cozy, dimly lit study, surrounded by shelves overflowing with ancient scrolls. The librarian is holding a glowing, futuristic tablet that displays a single, clear command-line interface. As the librarian touches the tablet, the scrolls around them illuminate, revealing their command-line secrets. Small, stylized icons representing 'fzf' and 'whiptail' float gently in the air. The repository name 'cheatshh' is subtly etched into the wooden desk. The overall mood is one of effortless knowledge retrieval and organization. 3D isometric illustration style with a warm, inviting color palette and soft lighting.

name: elementBlur
description: A simple browser extension to blur or highlight elements on any webpage.
readme_summary: Element Blur & Highlight Extension is a browser extension that allows users to selectively blur or highlight elements, text, or custom regions on any webpage. It offers dual modes for blurring and highlighting, with controls for color, opacity, and intensity, along with undo/redo functionality and screenshot capabilities.
primary_use_case: To obscure sensitive information or emphasize specific content on webpages for privacy, focus, or presentation purposes.
cover_image_prompt: A digital artist's hand holding a magic wand, hovering over a webpage displayed on a tablet. The wand emits two distinct beams of light: one that creates a soft, hazy blur over a sensitive document icon, and another that casts a vibrant yellow glow over an important notification. Subtle UI elements like sliders and color palettes float around the hand, indicating control. The background is a clean, modern workspace with faint code snippets visible on a secondary screen. The overall mood is one of precise control and visual enhancement. 3D isometric illustration style with a clean, bright color palette and soft shadows.
